text:
I want to create a page where someone can enter their email address to kick off the unsubscribe process. Most of the guidance I find only discusses the part after email is sent and they arrive at the preferences page. But I'm having trouble with the first page, showing the input box for the email address field.
I tried using the "Backup Unsubscribe" directly on my page but it just shows the -Error message- value, never the input box.
I also tried making a page with template where the templatetype is `email_backup_unsubscribe_page`. But it seems these template types are not available to be used for pages, only can be used in settings (Settings / Marketing / Email / Subscriptions).
How can I complete step 1 of just creating the unsubscribe page for the user?
Why do you need an input box for the email address? If someone clicks through to unsub from an email, HubSpot already knows which email/contact it is.

In my case, they are not coming from an email, they're coming from a website.

We currently have a custom solution, outside of HubSpot, just to support this. I was hoping I could do this within HubSpot.

This is our custom solution <https://resources.magicleap.com/en-us/access-preference-center>
I saw another post where someone had a similar situation and ended up doing it with workflows. I might go with that approach.

HubSpot has a system template called "<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/design-manager/use-system-templates-to-customize-error-subscription-and-password-prompt-pages|Backup unsubscribe page>" that may be what you're looking for, or a starting point. It comes with the option to enter an email address.

I'll check out the article.
Thanks for the help :bow:
